meanings.definition: The act of whipping or beating as a form of punishment or religious practice.
meanings.sent1: The flagellation of the criminal was a common form of punishment in ancient times.
meanings.sent2: The flagellation of the drum created a rhythmic sound in the parade.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor's flagellation scene was so realistic that the audience gasped.
meanings.sent4: The flagellation of the waves against the shore sounded like a distant drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The flagellation of the wind against the sails propelled the boat forward.

meanings.definition: The practice of whipping oneself as a form of religious discipline.
meanings.sent1: In some religious ceremonies, flagellation is used as a way to show devotion.
meanings.sent2: The monk's flagellation was a private ritual he performed every evening.
meanings.sent3: The flagellation of the pen on paper was a writer's way of expressing creativity.
meanings.sent4: The flagellation of the branches in the wind made the trees sway gently.
meanings.sent5: The flagellation of the rain against the window was soothing to listen to.
